Detailed Description

The OSMRelation class is used to hold information about relations within an OSMMap. As the nodes and ways within a relation are stored only as id numbers, each instance of the OSMRelation class requires an OSMMap as its parent. This parent is used to get pointers to the OSMNode and OSMWay objects for each member.

void OSMRelation::addMember ( QXmlStreamReader &  xml  ) 

Read an OSMRelationMember object from the given QXmlStreamReader object and add it to the relation. The xml stream needs to be at the start of a member element. (i.e. xml.isStartElement() && xml.name() == "member")

Parameters:
xml The QXmlStreamReader to be read from

Definition at line 75 of file osmrelation.cpp.

References getMemberNode().

OSMNode * OSMRelation::getMemberNode ( OSMRelationMember  member  ) 

This function uses OSMMap::getNodeById() in the parent OSMMap to return a pointer to the OSMNode object referenced by the OSMRelationMember provided. This function should be used in conjunction with getMemberType() to make sure the OSMRelationMember you are requesting represents a node, rather than a way.

Parameters:
member The OSMRelationMember representing the OSMNode to be returned
Returns:
The OSMNode represented by member

Definition at line 67 of file osmrelation.cpp.

References OSMMap::getNodePtrById(), OSMRelationMember::ref(), and OSMRelationMember::type().

Referenced by getMemberNode().

OSMRelationMember::Type OSMRelation::getMemberType ( int  i  ) 

Returns the type of the member at position i in the QList used to hold the members (the same QList returned my members() ). This (or getMemberType( OSMRelationMember ) ) should be used before getMemberNode() or getMemberWay() to ensure you use the correct function to get the OSMNode or OSMWay.

Parameters:
i The position of the member within the QList
Returns:
The type of the member at position i (i.e. members().at( i ).type() )

Definition at line 62 of file osmrelation.cpp.

OSMRelationMember::Type OSMRelation::getMemberType ( OSMRelationMember  member  ) 

Returns the type of the provided member. This (or getMemberType( int ) ) should be used before getMemberNode() or getMemberWay() to ensure you use the correct function to get the OSMNode or OSMWay.

Parameters:
member An OSMRelationMember object, the function will return the type of this object
Returns:

OSMWay * OSMRelation::getMemberWay ( OSMRelationMember  member  ) 

This function uses OSMMap::getWayById() in the parent OSMMap to return a pointer to the OSMWay object referenced by the OSMRelationMember provided. This function should be used in conjunction with getMemberType() to make sure the OSMRelationMember you are requesting represents a way, rather than a node.
